dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) Bye, Mom! Bye, Dad!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) Drive carefully!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Have fun, you two.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Yes, we will have as much fun as possible on our... (sigh) Titanic-themed getaway.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Let’s lose the ‘tude, please, it’s supposed to be romantic.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Didn't like, five thousand people die on the Titanic?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: The getaway is based on the movie, not the disaster.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Speaking of disasters, Dad, we are leaving you in charge, here.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: I know, can we wrap this up? Morty and I have synthetic laser eels oxidizing in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Hey, don’t blow me off, I’m drawing a line. Any damage to this house or these children when we get back, and... no more adventures with Morty.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 2.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (to Rick) Holy crap, if Mom's saying it, it must be serious this time.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) That's right - wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Listen, you have my word as a caregiver, everything will be fine. And if not, like you say, no more adventures or whatever. Beth and Jerry get into the car.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Not one thing out of place. They back out of the driveway, pull into the road, and st

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Not a single thing. The car takes off around the corner. A beat, and then a school of synthetic laser eels eat thr the garage door and swim away into the atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: (observing) Well, we're past the point of no return, I’m going to have a party.

dialogues.speaker: ACT ONE
dialogues.text: INT. MORTY’S HOME - KITCHEN - LATER Summer is standing in front of an open cupboard and talki on her phone.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: I found jello, can you sneak your mom’s vodka? (pause) Yes, she does, I saw it in your laundry room. (pause) Listen, you can’t both be in denial about it. Okay, this party is going to be epic, see you soon. She hangs up. Morty enters.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Summer, you can’t throw a party! Remember what Mom said?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Yeah, if anything gets messed up, you and Grandpa Rick get punished. I’m only a human being, Morty. Rick enters.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Tell Summer she can’t have a party!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Summer, you can’t have a party. She scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Because I'm having a party.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: What?! Rick, you can’t!

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: What do you mean you’re having a party? Are some glip glops from the third dimension going to come over and play cards or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "“RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 4.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: “Glip glop?!” Man, you’re lucky a Trakflorian doesn’t hear you say that.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Why, is that like their N-Word?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: It’s like the N word and the C word had a baby and it was raised by all the bad words for Jews.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: I think the three of us could just have a nice time bonding and getting to know each other.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Screw that. It’s party time. This is my chance to gain some footing with the cool kids.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: That's why you party? Boy you really are seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Why do you party?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: To get- (shaking face) Wriggedy wriggedy WRECKED, son!

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Just keep your sci-fi friends away from my awesome ones.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, and you keep your awesome friends away from my canapes. Reveal: Rick delicately making a plate of hors d’oevres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Jerry are being shown around by a TOUR GUIDE.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 5.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE
dialogues.text: The Titanic 2 is the most state-of- the art Titanic replica ever designed of the three, not including the one spelled with a T- 0-0. They use bio-diesel.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PATRON
dialogues.text: Is this where the lifeboats should have been?

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE
dialogues.text: Exactly correct. You miss nothing, do you? The crowd gasps. He knocks The group

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (whispering) That’s from the movie! This guy is a pro.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE
dialogues.text: After dinner, Titanic 2 will attach to the rail system near our replica iceberg, and the hydraulics encased in these tubes- on a tubular column.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE
dialogues.text: -will execute a controlled sink into the icy depths. (aside) Icy and depths are simulated, of course.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. A rail system seems archaic for an attraction this impressive, are you sure that the ship will sink?

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE
dialogues.text: I can assure you the ship will sink as it has a thousand times before. It’s UN-unsinkable. claps politely.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Pro.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry spots a line of people at the bow.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Look, it’s the line for the bow!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Jerry, work has been really stressful lately. I'd love to just kick back with a margarita and read. Do you mind if I skip the “King of the World” bit?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Well, ugh, it’s not the “King of the World bit”, that’s Jack and Fabrizio. This is where Rose says “I'm flying, Jack”, but whatever, I can be the only one to do it alone. Beth looks around in frustration and spots LUCY, a full- figured cleaning lady watching the attraction fondly.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What about her? (to Lucy) Excuse me, ma’am. Would you like to take my place in line? Lucy cautiously approaches.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I... I could get in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: We won’t tell. Beth removes her hat and places it on Lucy’s head. She st out of line and inserts Lucy next to Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Come on, Beth, this is weird.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Weirder than a grown man standing on the bow of a fake Titanic by himself?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Can’t argue there. Catch up with you later. Beth walks away and pulls out a giant book about horses.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 7.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Boom goes the dynamite.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (to Lucy) So... you’re a Titanic fanatic?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Oh yes. I’ve worked here since it opened but I’ve never been able to participate.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Happy to help, Rose. He links arms with her. She giggles. INT. MORTY’S HOME - LIVING ROOM - THAT EVENING A handful of kids sit around drinking out of red plastic cups. The doorbell rings. Summer opens the door to reveal BRAD and his crew.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Brad! Hey!

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: (blows past her) Yo. Summer’s slutty friend TAMMY perks up.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Brad is here! Quick, make my hair look drunk. Her SLUTTY FRIENDS muss her hair. Brad passes with his entourage.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Check it out. Tammy’s already drunk. Cool. Summer tries to close the door, but it’s stopped. She loo up to see BIRDPERSON, a statuesque hawk-man.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: The beacon was activated, who is in danger?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Grandpa!  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 8. Rick walks up.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Birdperson! They exchange a ceremonial arm flapping greeting.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Everything’s cool, BP. I’m just having a party.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: I am pleased there is no emergency.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Oh there’s an emergency alright. A pussy emergency. When was the last time you got laid, ‘Pers?

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: It has been a... challenging mating season for Birdperson.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Then it’s time to get your beak wet tonight, playa. Go have some fun. Rick waves him into the party.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: How many people did you invite, Rick?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: People? (thinks) Six.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. That’s not so bad. Bright light blasts through the windows. The whole house shakes as a SPACE SHIP touches down in the front yard. A SHITLOAD OF ALIENS pour out. Rick opens the door to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: What up, my glip glops! Morty fumes.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 9. INT. MORTY’S HOME - LIVING ROOM - SOON Morty runs around the party cleaning up messes as they’re created; picking up cigarette butts, empty bottles, etc. ANGLE ON: A group of KIDS are watching TV. An ALIEN CREAT on screen crawls towards camera, then out of the TV ala “ Ring.”

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN CREATURE
dialogues.text: Aw yeah, you got a party going on in here? A DRUNK GUY stumbles up.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK GUY
dialogues.text: What are you guys watching?

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGERS
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) Get out of the way!

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN CREATURE
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) Get out of the way!

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK GUY
dialogues.text: You guys suck. He stumbles away and trips the cord, causing the TV to tu off, trapping the alien halfway in/halfway out of the scr As it struggles to free itself out, it pulls the whole TV down, smashing it on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Oh man!!

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN CREATURE
dialogues.text: Hey. Sorry, bro. That was just a party trick gone bad. Normally, I go inside a TV set when no one’s looking, and crawl out once a decent crowd has gathered. It’s a real big hit usually. INT. MORTY’S HOME - JERRY & BETH’S BEDROOM - NIGHT TWO TEENAGERS grind away under the covers. Morty busts in

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Not in my parent’s bed!  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 10. It's revealed that the two teenagers are actually protrus on a larger ALIEN CREATURE’S back.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN CREATURE
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. I’m not feeling too well. I just needed to lie down for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. The creature barfs acidic slime all over the bed. The bed dissolves. INT. MORTY’S HOME - LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Two CYBER WARRIORS battle in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: CYBER WARRIOR
dialogues.text: Tammy is mine!

dialogues.speaker: CYBER WARRIOR
dialogues.text: I called dibs! They battle through the living room, destroying the place

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Stop! She’s not that hot! ANGLE ON: Rick chats with GEARHEAD, a muscle bound cyborg with gears for a mouth and a translucent body that shows gears.

dialogues.speaker: GEARHEAD
dialogues.text: The thing people don’t realize about the Gear Wars is that it was never really about the gears at all. Rick feigns enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Yeah. No. Totally. Morty comes up.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Rick! You gotta st-

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Morty! Have you met Gearhead?  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 11.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (to Gearhead) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Morty would love to hear all about the Gear Wars. Rick takes off. Gearhead looks down at Morty.

dialogues.speaker: GEARHEAD
dialogues.text: How familiar are you with the Gear Wars exactly?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Um, not at all.

dialogues.speaker: GEARHEAD
dialogues.text: (rubs his hands, excited) Oh boy. I envy you. Okay, here goes- EXT. MORTY’S HOME - LATER The party is bumping. We see a flying saucer land. Two creatures climb out and enter the party followed by a few high school students walking in from the street. INT. MORTY’S HOME - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Rick’s talking to an ALIEN. Morty runs up to him.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Hey, Morty, have you met Scorpius?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Not again, Rick. That guy droned on for twenty minutes and meanwhile, the house is being destroyed!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (re: Scorpius) This guy’s entire planet was destroyed. Have some perspective. SQUANCHY, a manic cat-like creature saunters up.

dialogues.speaker: SQUANCHY
dialogues.text: Hey, Rick, squanchy party, bro! Is there a good place for me to squanch around here?  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 12.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Come on, Squanchy, you know any place is a good place for you to squanch.

dialogues.speaker: SQUANCHY
dialogues.text: Alright! I like your squanch! Squanchy scurries off.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Okay, Rick, what exactly is “squanching?”

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it, Morty. You wouldn’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Is it going to result in another mess for me to clean up?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Morty, we've had a lot of cool adventures the last few months, but it’s time to relax.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: If I relax, there might not be any more adventures.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Jesus, Morty, you’re bumming me out. Can’t we just pretend like everything is fine for a few hours, enjoy ourselves, and then worry about it later?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: That’s easy for you to say, you like not caring about stuff, what’s in this for me? Just then, JESSICA enters the party and walks right into Morty’s eyeline. Everything slows down. “Dreamweaver” or something less hacky plays. Jessica whips her hair back.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (slow mo voice) Jessica... We pan over to Rick, also in slow motion, who looks off camera.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 13.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (slow mo) Knock it off, Lord Chronos! ANGLE ON: LORD CHRONOS, a Ming the Merciless looking dude using his mastery over time to slow down it down. He's obviously very drunk. He stops and everything snaps back normal speed.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CHRONOS
dialogues.text: (sloppy drunk) Hahaha Sorry! (explaining to a friend) I have the power to manipulate time-

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (irritated) Yeah, like there’s anyone left that hasn’t heard.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (re: Jessica) I can’t believe she’s here.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Well what are you doing standing here, Morty? Go talk to her. Rick shoves Morty in Jessica’s direction.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Have some fun. Tonight, the only adventure you’re on is your cusping manhood. Rick swigs his drink and walks off. Morty approaches Jess

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Hey, Jessica! Lord Chronos drunkenly stumbles over behind Jessica and l against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Hey, Morty. Cool party! So this is where you live, huh? Jessica turn to look around right as Lord Chronos begins puking.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Oh my god, that guy just puked on the wall!  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 14. Lord Chronos drunkenly tries to kick his puke under a doo

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: You know what, Jessica? Don’t even worry about it. Someone’1ll deal with it later. Lets go have some fun! Morty leads Jessica off into the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry and Lucy run through the ship, laughing. Jerry stea cigarette from an unsuspecting person’s mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry and Lucy stop at the deck railing. Employees are stocking floating door rafts.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Is that what I think it is?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Yes, every couple gets to recreate Jack's drowning at the end of the movie. It’s so romantic.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: I can’t wait to do that with Beth.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Please, anyone can see that when it comes to movies released in 1997, Beth is a Fifth Elementer all the way.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Is that what they call fans of “The Fifth Element?”

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Of course! Can’t you see she’s doing everything in her power to push us closer together? They exchange a gaze before Jerry’s attention is diverted

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Look! ANGLE ON: The iceberg is approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couples pour to the railing. Jerry looks for Beth to no avail. He turns back to see that the ship is moving away "“RICKSY BUSINESS"

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Iceberg, right ahead! The buffet is now closed. Iceberg, right ahead! The buffet is now closed... the iceberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CREWMAN is consulting some instruments.

dialogues.speaker: CREWMAN
dialogues.text: Uh, sir? There’s not a problem.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: What do you mean, there’s not a problem?

dialogues.speaker: CREWMAN
dialogues.text: The guidance system isn’t putting us on a direct collision course. Sir. (dramatic) This ship is about to completely miss that giant iceberg.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Well, DO SOMETHING! Steer into it!

dialogues.speaker: CREWMAN
dialogues.text: I’m TRYING! He’s trying desperately to steer the ship. Different departments scramble to turn the ship. Sailors back and forth from bow to stern. The crewman’s eyes wide

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: It’s too late. (gets on P.A.) Ladies and gentlemen... don’t brace yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An overhead shot of the ship as it slowly floats past the iceberg. NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 15.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd gasps.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: No! What happened?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: The rail system must have failed. People stand on the deck, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: PAYING CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: Does this mean we're not going to sink?

dialogues.speaker: PAYING CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: Dear God. Panicked murmurs break out. INT. MORTY’S HOME - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Tammy is flirting with Birdperson on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: I like your feathers.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: They are designed to attract the attention of the female.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: It’s working.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: Tammy, I should let you know, I just got out of a pretty intense soul bond with my previous spirit mate.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: I’m not looking to get into a soul bond. I’m just looking for... She whispers something in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: I believe Birdperson can arrange that.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 17. INT. MORTY’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS Summer and her friends are hanging out. NANCY, a nerdy gi walks over to Summer.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Hey, Summer. Haven’t seen you at flute practice in awhile.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER'S FRIEND
dialogues.text: Summer, are you friends with her?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Pfth. No. I don’t even know what she’s doing here.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Not cool, Summer. It’s a party, everyone should be welcome. The kitchen wall explodes. Everyone backs away as a menac figure steps through a cloud of smoke into the kitchen. T is ABRODOLPH LINCOLER, a large, intimidating man that loo like a cross between Lincoln and Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: ABRODOLPH LINCOLER
dialogues.text: Where... is... Rick Sanchez?!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Oh no... I can’t believe he showed up.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: What’s the matter, Rick? I thought everyone was welcome.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: It’s not the same, Summer. Abrodolph Lincoler is a crazed maniac. A misguided effort of mine to create a morally neutral super leader by combining the DNA of Adolph Hitler and Abraham Lincoln. Turns out it adds up to a lame wack job. Lincoler spots Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "“RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 18.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLER
dialogues.text: Rick... You brought me into this world, a suffering abomination tortured by the duality of its being, but I shall finally know peace when I watch the life drain from your wretched body. He pulls out a gun and advances towards Rick. As he does, bumps into Brad, causing him to spill his drink.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Whoa. What’s up, man?

dialogues.speaker: ABRODOLPH LINCOLER
dialogues.text: It was an accident. I have no quarrel with you, boy. Brad gets in his face.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Boy? What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: ABRODOLPH LINCOLER
dialogues.text: It just- Look, I don’t know how you thought I meant it, but... Lincoler shoots Rick a “help me out here” look.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Don’t look at me, dude.

dialogues.speaker: ABRODOLPH LINCOLER
dialogues.text: Look, I’m half Abraham Lincoln, SO...

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: So... I should get on my knees and kiss your ass?

dialogues.speaker: ABRODOLPH LINCOLER
dialogues.text: No, but, you know...

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: What do I know? That the Third Reich will reign for a thousand years?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Leave him alone, Brad!

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Stay out of this, Jessica!  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 19.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Kick his ass, Brad! Everyone starts chanting for Brad to kick Lincoler’s ass.

dialogues.speaker: ABRODOLPH LINCOLER
dialogues.text: Look, let’s talk about this-— Brad starts beating the shit out of Lincoler.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Brad! Jessica runs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Rick!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: I just did you a favor, Morty. You can thank me later. EXT. MORTY’S HOME - MOMENTS LATER Jessica pouts outside. Morty comes out and sits next to h

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Sorry about all that. Rick has some pretty strange friends.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Uch. Brad is such a jerk. He's always trying to prove what a man he is. I’m so sick of those kinds of guys. I just want to find somebody nice and sweet. Morty smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Jessica, can I show you something? INT. MORTY’S HOME - GARAGE - SOON Morty flips on the light, revealing the workshop. They en Jessica looks around in awe of all the crazy stuff.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: This place is incredible.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 20.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s where my grandfather and I do all our science stuff. Check this out. Morty activates a device that creates floating balls of colored energy that dance around the room and change into shapes.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: It’s beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: You know, Jessica, there’s something I’ve always wanted to tell you. She draws closer.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: What’s that, Morty?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: I think that you’re the most-

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: No. That. Those weird sounds coming from the closet over there. Morty listens. There’s a rustling sound coming from a STO CLOSET. Morty slowly walks over and carefully pulls the d open.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Ooh! Inside, he finds Squanchy holding a taut cord wrapped aro his neck while he jerks off his bizarre alien genitalia.

dialogues.speaker: SQUANCHY
dialogues.text: Hey! I’m squanching in here!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Whoa! Morty falls backwards into the controls of a TELEPORTATIO MACHINE. It tips over on the floor and starts to spark. Energy blasts out of it, consuming the entire room.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 21. EXT. MORTY’S HOME - CONTINUOUS The energy blasts shoots out of the garage and form a hug sphere centered around the garage, but encompassing the entire house. A flash. Everything inside the sphere is go leaving a massive dirt hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a strange alien landscape, with large lumbering lu monsters roaming about. A flash. The house materializes i the middle of the scene, complete with the dirt under it. INT. MORTY’S HOME - CONTINUOUS The house shakes as it settles into position. Everyone st partying. Rick looks outside and surveys the landscape.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Hmm, big star in the sky. (inhales) Oxygen-rich atmosphere. (observing) Giant testicle monsters. He faces the party.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: We'll be fine, let’s party! Everyone in the crowd screams “party!” A kid removes his shirt and runs out the door.

dialogues.speaker: PAAAAARRRRTYYYYYY
dialogues.text: He approaches a lump monster, who, in a quick motion, stu him into a fleshy hole between its giant lumps.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Uh, did anyone like that guy? No response. Rick hits the stereo. “Shake that ass” plays

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Shake that ass, bitch, and let me see what you got! Everyone cheers.

dialogues.speaker: ACT TWO
dialogues.text: INT. MORTY’S HOME - NIGHT Morty has cornered Rick and Summer.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Rick! We’ve been transported to another dimension! When mom and dad come home, we’re gonna be so screwed! Rick grabs Morty.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Pull it together, Morty! Stop trying to pretend there’s stakes!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: But what about the house, Rick?! Where are we?! What are we going to do?!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Relax, Morty. Reeelaaaax. It’s going to be fine. All we have to do is go out and find us some Kalaxian crystals. We get some of those and everything’1l be juuuust fine.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Okay. Let’s go, Rick. Let’s go get those crystals.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: I can’t go with you, Morty. This is your time to show everyone that you're not just some stupid, whiny, annoying little turd. You've got to show them that you’re a hero. Morty looks around the room at everyone. He sees Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Okay. I’11 do it.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Good. Take Lincoler with you. Lincoler sits in a corner holding an ice pack to his head

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLER
dialogues.text: I'm injured.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 23.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Shut up, Lincoler. It’s the least you can do for wrecking the kitchen. Lincoler reluctantly gets up and joins Morty.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Nancy, you should go too!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What? Why me?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Because... (she looks at her friends) Flutes are stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers run frantically. A customer service line stret out the door. The man-made lake is being drained as mecha wade through the water. Beth and Jerry are approached by “captain.”

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Sorry for the inconvenience, folks, we should resume sinking shortly. In the meantime, please stay on the ship and enjoy a complimentary plate of James Cameronion rings. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Great. Not only is the ship not sinking, but now the fourth wall’s been broken.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I’m going back to the room to finish my book. You should find that Lucy woman.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: It’s true, you do want me to be with her!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Jerry, I’m tired, they won’t reopen the buffet, and I think you’1l have more fun with someone who’s interested in Titanic.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 24. Beth exits. Jerry sees Lucy watching from down the hall. approaches.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: You don’t know what she’s like when you’re not around.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: May I show you something, Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is showing Jerry around.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Had everything gone as planned, this entire area would be under water.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: I would have liked to see it. This trip has been a titanic failure. Get it? Jerry turns around to see Lucy completely naked except fo diamond necklace.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Draw me, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Oh boy. Lucy... wow. This... isn’t what I had in mind.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: But it’s the perfect moment. We've been dreaming about this for sixteen years.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Not like this. Not with you. Lucy pulls a gun.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: You're going to draw me. Then... She gestures to an old timey car.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: ...you’re going to fuck me in that car over there.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morty, Lincoler, and Nancy walk through a strange jungle. Morty uses a beeping device to find the crystals.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: The crystals should be close.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: There they are! A cluster of blue crystals jut out of the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLER
dialogues.text: Wait. Something’s not right... A BIZARRE CREATURE leaps out in front of them. It’s swift moves on all fours.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLER
dialogues.text: Get the crystals! I’1ll handle the beast. Morty and Nancy go gather the crystals while Lincoler fig the creature.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Summer’s gonna like me again! Lincoler successfully kills the creature and then collaps against a rock.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Lincoler, come on, let’s get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLER
dialogues.text: Mein journey is over, Morty. Morty looks down to see a giant blood stain on Lincoler’s belly.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLER
dialogues.text: Morty... I have something important to tell you... INT. MORTY’S HOME - SOON Jessica sits on the couch with Gearhead as he strums an a guitar. Morty enters. He’s covered in blood and his cloth are torn.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 26.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (panting) Rick... I got them... I got the crystals...

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Alright! You did it, Morty! Rick takes the crystals and heads off.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Rick, wait. There’s something you need to know. (as Morty talks, an emotional score rises) I couldn’t have done it without Lincoler. He said that he was sorry and that he loves you like a father. He only wanted you to accept him and he hopes that his final act would redeem him in your eyes. He sacrificed himself to save all of us, Rick. He died. Rick, just as he finishes chopping up the crystals into a fine powder. He snorts a big line.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Huh. Well I have to hand it to him...

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: That’s the first cool thing he ever did. Wubba lubba dub dub! (point to the DJ) Kick it! The DJ does a record scratch. Rick begins an elaborately choreographed dance with improvised lyrics.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: You put your right foot forward and left foot back/ Then slide around like on a Nordic track/etc. People start joining in. Birdperson nods his head to the beat. Rick’s weirdly mainstream intergalactic rap and weirdly choreographed but intensely sweaty, tweaky dance continue  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 27. The last of Summer’s friends join Rick. She’s disgusted a first, but then eventually joins the rest of the dancers. The song ends. Everybody claps and cheers.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: What... the... hell... was that?! I thought those crystals were supposed to help us get home or something! !

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: What? No, I can get us home whenever I want to. But listen, speaking of those crystals... can I get the rest of them? I’m starting to come down, Morty. Crystal Kalaxian is a strong but fleeting high. Morty pulls the pouch of crystals out of his pocket, walk the sliding glass door, opens it, and throws them directl into the gaping mouth of a lumpy beast monster.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: That’s what I think of your crystals Rick! Rick holds his hand to his head. He’s in discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Noooo! Morty you idiot!! (looking around) Does anyone else have any more K- Lax? Bird Person? Squanchy? They shake their heads no. We see the lump monster dancin around outside.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (announcing) This party is officially over! Rick, take us home. Now.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Alright, Captain Buzzkill of the Starship Party Pooper. Everybody groans and gives Morty the stink eye. Rick goes to the garage.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry is nervously finishing his sketch.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Almost finished, Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Uh... Almost. I haven’t quite captured your beautiful eyes. REVEAL: The drawing is terrible.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I’m sure It’s good enough.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Um... Just a little bit long- Lucy picks up her gun.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Move! Jerry moves to the car, Lucy nakedly follows.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Every weekend Jacks and Roses have their Titanic experience in this car, and I have to mop it up. The floor drops out to make it easier. Lucy kicks the car and the floor drops. It’s REALLY rusty

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: But now it’s my turn. We’re going to get it nice and steamy in there. And I’m going to slam my hand on the steam. And then you’re going to love inside of me. No mess. No clean. She pushes him into the car with the gun. A huge hardcove book comes flying out of nowhere and strikes Lucy’s head. falls, unconscious. REVEAL: BETH stands over her slumped body.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Beth!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Bet you’re glad I think Kindles are dumb now.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 29. They embrace. Jerry’s drawing floats onto Lucy’s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry is packing a stockpile of memorabilia into the car.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I can’t help but feel a little guilty about what happened. I didn’t peg Lucy for a rapist.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: And what does a rapist look like, exactly, Beth? Is it a Slavic man wearing a denim jacket with a patchy beard and the scent of cheap champagne wafting over his blister pocked lips? Beth thinks for a moment then:

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Jerry... this is the first time someone has tried to rape you, right?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (unconvincing) Of course. Beth gets in the driver’s side.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Well, at least you got all this free stuff. Should be enough to satisfy your Titanic jones for awhile. Jerry crams the replica door into car, but it’s taking up much room in the passenger seat for him to get in.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: I- I’m not going to fit. You’l1l have to go without me. Jerry reaches his arms through the window towards Beth, b she’s just out of his reach. He gazes into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Beth, listen to me. You’re going to get out of here. You’re going to go on and watch our kids grow old. I... love... you.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 30. He touches her fingers through the side window and slowly retreats, mimicking Leo disappearing into the dark sea.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Jerry, just leave the door. We don’t have room for it and it smells bad. Jerry shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Jerry tosses the door out, climbs in, and Beth starts up car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry pulls the diamond necklace out.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: You’1ll always be my Rose, Beth. He throws the diamond necklace out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow the necklace down to reveal Lucy hanging undern the car. She lets out a wild cackle. We hold on her for a beat, and then the car shifts into drive and begins to mo Lucy’s fingers instantly slip and she falls to the ground The back tire runs over her legs. She doubles over in ago EXT. MORTY’S HOME - CONTINUOUS The house zaps through a variety of dimensions. We see al kinds of crazy shit. It finally gets back to Earth. INT. MORTY’S HOME - DAWN Morty holds the door open as everyone leaves.

dialogues.speaker: SQUANCHY
dialogues.text: The party squanches on at my place! Everyone cheers.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Cool! I’m coming too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "“RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 31.

dialogues.speaker: SQUANCHY
dialogues.text: No. You’re not squanchy enough for a squanchy party.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: What? (summer looks around) Guys? Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: He’s right, Summer. We all hate people who throw parties that end too soon. Later. Brad and the last of the party goers leave. Morty slams t door. Summer slumps over to Rick, who appears to be passe out on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Okay. You were right, Grandpa Rick. Next party, I’m just going to have a good time. Screw other people.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (Inaudible mumble) Summer exits. Morty cleans up. Birdperson approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: May I assist you with that?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Uh, sure, thanks. Birdperson puts bottles into a garbage bag.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: Morty, do you know what “Wubba lubba dub dubs” means?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Rick’s stupid nonsense catchphrase.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: It’s not nonsense at all. In my people’s tongue it means: “I am in great pain. Please help me.”

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Well I got news for you, he’s saying it ironically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "“RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 32.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: No, Morty, your grandfather is indeed in very deep pain. The things he has seen in the universe. The knowledge he has. It has all left a hole deep in his soul that nothing can fill. That is why he must numb himself. Morty looks over at Rick snoring on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Come on, um...

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: Birdperson.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Come on, Birdperson, Rick’s not that complicated. He’s just an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: Then why do you care so much if you are no longer allowed to continue on your adventures together? It appears fate has presented you with an opportunity to free yourself of Rick forever.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: You're right. I shouldn’t care. This is probably the best thing that could happen to me. I’m sick of having adventures with Rick.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: My people have another saying: “Gubba nub nub doo rah kah.” It means “whatever lets you sleep at night.” Summer runs in.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Mom and Dad are home!!

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: This is your moment, Morty. Before you are two very different paths. Choose wisely. (yells off screen) Tammy!!  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 33. Tammy runs in and jumps on his back. He flaps his wings a they fly away. EXT. MORTY’S HOME - CONTINUOUS Jerry and Beth’s car pulls into the driveway. INT. MORTY’S HOME - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Summer runs around trying to clean the house up.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: We are so screwed!!!! Morty looks from Summer to Rick on the couch. He goes ove and shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Rick! Rick! Wake up! Rick swats him away.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Rick, you gotta do something quick. My parents are home. Rick sits up on the couch and rubs his temples.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Alright. Hold on. Morty looks out a window. Rick takes a long sip from a gl of water.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Um. So good.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: They're walking up the driveway!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (snaps his fingers) Bring me the thing...

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: What thing?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: The thing, the thing. It’s got the buttons and the lights. It beeps. Come on, Morty, you know what I’m talking about. The thing.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 34.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Rick, that describes everything in your garage. Summer runs in holding a DOODAD.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Do you mean this?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Summer with the win. Rick activates the doodad. It lights up and makes some be A pulse ripples through the living room.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: That should do it.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: See for yourself. Morty opens the door to reveal BETH and JERRY frozen.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Everything is frozen in time. The whole world.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: How long do you want? A week? A month?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Can we start cleaning the house and see how we feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spend the next three months cleaning the house, play around in the frozen world and getting to know each other  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sunrise is frozen in the sky. Rick, Morty, and Summer s in front of a television connected to hundreds of extensi cords. On screen, the credits for Titanic are rolling.

dialogues.speaker: RICK/MORTY/SUMMER
dialogues.text: Dumb. They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: This has been so much fun. I’m almost over being somewhat responsible for Nancy's death.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, I have to say, it’s pretty nice hanging out with my grand kids.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Hey, Rick, you know, I haven't heard you say that “Wubba lubba dub dub” thing you say this whole time.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Don’t need to. I have a new catch phrase.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: What’s that, Rick?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: I love my grand kids.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) Awww...

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) Ohhh... They all hug.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Just kidding. You’re both gay.

dialogues.speaker: TEN MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Birdperson lands next to Rick in an empty lot.  RAM 110 "RICKSY BUSINESS" NETWORK DRAFT (5/10/13) 36.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: The beacon was activated- Rick starts hitting him.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: You told my grandson about “Wubba lubba dub dubs?!” You son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: BIRDPERSON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry! I’m sorry! A cartoon iris closes around them as Rick kicks Birdperso the shins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow push in to a bubbling pit of green ooze. A hand emer from it. Nancy slowly rises from the pit and pulls hersel onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Revenge... A lump monster grabs her and stuff her into its lumps the spits her out and passes her to another lump monster who spits out the kid from the party.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM KID
dialogues.text: Party! They continue passing them back and forth into each other lump holes.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Revenge. She goes in. Random kid comes out.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM KID
dialogues.text: Party! He goes in. Nancy comes out. Etc.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Revenge.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM KID
dialogues.text: Party!
